review_blob: Draft  Poured a hazy golden with a good white head.  The head had good lasting and laced quite well.  Had decent aroma of malt, hops, citrus, and spices.  Had a great mouthfeel.  A good finish with a pleasent aftertaste.  Brewed a couple blocks from my house.  I am happy theyb are here.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Draft @ Richboro Pub  Pours a hazy amber with a decent off white head.  The head laste well and laces quite nicely.  Has a good aroma of malts, bread, and a touch of sweet fruit.  The flavor is toaty and earthy.  Has a medium body, a slick texture, good carbonation.  The finish is good with a mild aftertaste.  A very easy drinking beer.

Bottle  Pours a cloudy copper with a big froathy off white head.  The head lasts very well and laces quite nicely.  Has a good aroma of citrus, peach and some malts.  Grapefruit really comes through.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is good and fruity.  Not as bitter as I would like but still very good.  Has a medium body.  The terxture is sticky.  Has a good finish and a pleasing aftertaste.
beer_name: Cigar City Humidor Series Jai Alai IPA - Juniper

review_blob: Draft at Brewery  Pours a clear amber with a white head that fades quickly.  Produces decent lacing.  The aroma is faint of spice and cookies.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is well balanced and malty.  Has a light body.  The texture is crisp and clean.  An easy finish and aftertaste.  Not great but not bad.

Draft at Brewery  Pours a good copper with a creamy white head, which lasts fairly well.  Decent lacing.  The aroma is very light but you can get hints of caramel.  The carbonation is good.  Flavor is sweet and malty.  Has a light body.  The finish is okay and aftertaste is nothing to really speak of.  Better than coors but on pace with Blue Moon drinkable but not my choice.

Draft at Brewery  So it should be fresh  Pours a decent amber with a thin white head.  The head leaves quickly but gives moderate lacing.  The aroma is of grain some caramel and a touch of floral.  Has a decent carbonation.  The taste is slight but hits most of the aromas.  Has a light body.  The finish is okay at best as is the aftertaste.  Not all bad and refreshing but definetly a MacroBrew.

Bottle  Pours A good dark brown with a creamy rerddish tan head.  The head is froathy and lasts well.  It leaves wonderful lacing.  Aroma is very chocolatey.  Reminds me of chocolatwe milk.  Has some burnt coffee, and a touch of citrus hops.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good and bold.  Nice chocolate base but has subtle flavors of coffee, floral and fruits which dance on the tongue.  Has a splendid mouthfeel.  The texture is creamy and thick.  Alcohol is well hidden.  The finish is good and a very pleasing aftertaste.  A real good beer.

Bottle  Pours a good brown with a thin light tan head.  The head last fairly well and laces fairly well also.  Aroma is sweet fruits, hints of vanilla.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is good but light for the alcohol.  Very well blended.  Has a watery texture.  The finish is good with a soft pleasing aftertaste.  Has a full body.  For a 12% beer you have a hard time finding that much alcohol.  Very smooth and drinkable.  Well done Founders...

Bottle Pours a good amber with a froathy off white head.  The head lasts well and laces great.  Aroma is weet fruit and earthy.  Has a good carbonation.  the flavor is real good sweet with an alcohol punch.  Has a full body.  The texture is a touch dry.  has a great finish and a wonderful aftertaste.  A real tasty beer that packs a serious punch at 12%.  I love this one.

Bottle  Pours a dark brown with a good tan head.  The head lasts well and produces excellent lacing.  Has a roasted malt aroma with sweet fruits, and citrus hops.  Good carbonation.  The flavor is decent, good bitterness but a huge metallic touch.  Has an oily texture.  The finish is okay and the aftertaste is real strong metallic.  Not a bad beer good flavors but the metallic taste just over powers the goodness of this beer.

Bottle  Pours a clear amber with a small off white head.  The head fades quickly, but laces fairly well.  Aroma is grass, honey, grain, dark fruits and floral.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is decent.  Very drinkable.  Has a medium body.  The texture is watery.  A easy drinking beer.  Not too deep in flavor but still fairly good.  has a decent finish and a lighter aftertaste.

Bottle  Pours a murky brown with a thin tan head.  The head leaves quickly, and leaves rings of lacing.  Has a good aroma of vanilla, caramel,and whiskey barrels.  Has a light cartbonation.  The flavor is real good.  Strong whiskey barrel but alcohol is not over bearing.  has a full body.  The texture is slick.  A real good finish with a great aftertaste.  A smooth good beer.  A big beer for sure but vwery drinkable.  Well Done.

Bottle  Pours a nice clear amber with a decent light tan head.  The head lasts well and laces okay.  Aoma is hoppy with hunts of grass, and some caramel.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is decent, good balance of malts and hops.  Very easy drinking.  Has a lighter body.  The texture is watery.  The finish is okay and a soft aftertaste.  Very decent beer but not real big in any one direction.

Bottle  from my Secret Santa, thanks  Pours a deep black with a thin tan head which fades very quickly.  No lacing to speak of.  Has a good aroma of coffee, chocolate, and some funky fruits.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Robust and hearty.  Has a light alcohol burn but is blended well.  Good amount of coffee and chocolate.  Has a slick watery texture.  The body is full.  A good finish with a pleasing aftertaste.  Overall a real good winter warmer.

Bottle from my Secret Santa, thanks Santa  Pours a good black with a thin tan head.  The head leaves rapidly but laces quite well.  Has a subtle aroma of chocolate, malt, roast, hints of vanilla, oak, and bourbon.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is good.  A decent light burn with plenty of sweetness.  A very hearty beer, good winter warmer.  Has a full body. The texture is thick.  has a strong finish with a good aftertaste.  Let this one warm as you sip it for good flavors.

Bottle from my Secret Santa, thanks Santa   Pours a nice deep brown with a bubbly light tan head.  The head fades quickly but laces well.  Aroma is all christmas spice, cinnamon, nutmeg, just makes you think christmas.  Has a light but good carbonation.  The flavor is awesome, cinnamon spice and very smooth.  Alcohol is very well hidden.  Has a medium body.  The texture is thin.  Awesome mouthfeel.  Great finish with a delightful aftertaste.  This is just about the best christmas beer I have ever had.  Really glad Santa sent me one but now I need to move to Ohio to get this every year.
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Barrel Aged Frosted Frog Christmas Ale

review_blob: Bottle from my secret Santa Thanks  Pours a hazy amber with a good tan head, the head is creamy and lasting, and makes decent lacing.  Aroma is pine, citrus, malts, and a touch of hops.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is well balanced between hops and malts with a good deal of both.  Has a medium body and a creamy texture.  Has a good mouthfeel.  the finish is super with a good aftertaste.  This is really tasty and I like it.
beer_name: The Brew Kettle Red Eye PA

review_blob: Bottle from Secret Santa thanks  Pours a good black with a thin red tan head that deminishes rapidly, leaves good lacing though.  Has a roast sweet malty aroma of bitter chocolate and coffee.  Has a good carbonation.  The texture is watery.  The flavor is very good.  Robust and well blended.  Nice flavors and easy drinking.  Has a medium body.  Areal good finish with a good aftertaste. Alcohol is very well hidden.  This is a real good beer.

Bottle thanks to my Secret Santa  Pours a cloudy amber with a thin light tan head.  The head fades with average speed and leaves spotty lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light but I get floral, light lemon citrus, some caramel malt, and a little evergreen.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good starts hoppy and has a malty finish.  Has a light to medium body.  The texture is slick.  Has a good finish with a decent aftertaste.  A decent beer that runs both ends of the table hoppy and malty.  Refreshing and easy drinking.
beer_name: The Brew Kettle 4 Cs Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle from Secret Santa, thanks Santa  Pours a clear orange amber with a thin off white head.  The head is creamy and lasting. It laces well also.Aroma is pine, citrus, light malt, and some floral.  Has decwent carbonation.  The flavor is good spicy, hoppy but not over hoppy.  Just real darn refreshing.  The texture is oily.  Has a great mouthfeel.  Has a medium body.  Has a nice bitter finish with a wonderful aftertaste.  The Frog comes through again with an excellent tasty beer.  Well done
beer_name: Hoppin Frog Fresh Frog Raw Hop Imperial Pale Ale

review_blob: Bottle thanks to my Cleveland buddy, Smenda.  Pours a clear amber with a thin white head.  The head vanishes quickly.  Has a good holiday aroma of spices, gingerbread, cinnamon, and malty.  The carbonation is real good.  Has good flavor, not over done and very smooth.  Easy to drink a refreshing holiday blend.  The texture is thick.  Has a medium body.  A real good finish and a nice aftertaste.  A decent beer and packs a good punch at 7.5%.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Tap  Pours a clear dark amber, almost brown with a froathy tan head which laces fairly well.  Has a good aroma of maltiness, hints of chocolate, and roast.  The carbonation is good.  Flavor is a smooth malty easy drinking beer.  Has a medium body.  The texture is slick.  Has a good finish and a nice aftertaste.  A pretty good drinking beer.

Bottle  Pours a clear amber with a beige head.  The head fades nicely and laces well.  Aroma is good mostly pumpkin, spices, some vanilla.  Smells like a good pumpkin pie as it should.  Has an average carbonation.  The flavor is good, nice spice back bone and ginger snap cookie like.  Has a medium body.  The texture is sticky.  Has a great mouthfeel.  A real good finish with a pleasing aftertaste.  I like the pumpkin beers and some are over done but this one hits the mark perfectly.  Exactly what I think the beer should be. very well done.

Bottle  Pours a cloudy amber with an off white head.  The head lasts okay and laces decently.  Aroma is weet caramel, cloves, some bananas, and touches of citrus.  Has a lively carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Nice mild sweetness that really come alive.  Has a medium body.  A good mouthfeel.  The texture is oily.  has a good finish and a good aftertaste.  This is a real tasty beer.

Bottle  Pours a amber red with a good light tan head.  The head is froathy and lasting. Produces spotty lacing.  Aroma is toffee sweetness, with hints of caramel, spice, and nuts.  Has a good carbonation.  the flavor is malty and sweet.  Has a medium body.  The texture is slick.  Has a decent finish, with a lasting aftertaste.  Not a bad beer.  Very drinkable but would like a touch more hoppiness.  Still pretty good.

Bottle  Pours a nice black with a thin light brown head.  The head deminishes quickly, and leaves decent lacing.  Has a good aroma of alcohol, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, hints of vanilla.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is decent.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Nice malty finish starts with spices and blends well to finish.  Has a full body and a slick texture.  The finish is good and has a good aftertaste.  Fairly easy drinking.
beer_name: Saint Arnold Pumpkinator Imperial Pumpkin Stout

Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is pretty good. A little too sweet for me but really drinkable.  has a medium body.  The finish is good and the aftertaste lingers for some time.  Not really my style but good.

Bottle Pours a hzy brown with a good beige head.  The head lasts well.  Laces fairly well also.  Has a good aroma of caramel, dark fruits and good malts. review_blob: On tap @ Bethlehem Brew Works  Pours a hazy yellow with a bubbling white head.   The head deminshing quickly and leaves a spotty lacing. A very refreshing beer with decent taste.

On Tap @ Bethlehem Brew Works  Pours a good black with a good tan head.  The head lasts okay and laces decently.  Has a good aroma of roast, milk chocolate, with hints of caramel and coffee.  Has an average carbonation.  A medium body.  has a real good flavor.  Good amount of sweetness, but blended real well.  A good compliment to some food pairings.  the finish is wonderful and a good aftertaste.  This is a real good beer, I like it a lot.

review_blob: Bottle  Pours a murky brown with a small light tan head.  The head last okay and laces well.  Aroma is mostly dark fruits, with some malt and alcohol. Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is shape and a little alcohol burn.  Not really bad for as high as it is.  Blended well.  Smooth to drink.  Has a  medium to full body.  Texture is sticky.  Has a good finish and a good aftertaste.  A pretty good beer but a little pricey.

Draft at Mahi Mahis in Virginia Beach  Pours a clear dark amber with a thin off white head which deminishes quickly.  Has spotty lacing at best.  The aroma is decent with caramel, nuts, some citrus, and faint hops.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Nice fullness and a good malt backbone with a decent amount of hops to make it well balanced.  It has a light to medium body.  the texture is thick.  You kind of eat this beer instead of drinking it.  Has good finish and a light aftertaste.  Overall a fairly good beer.

Can Pours a solid black with a good light tan head.  The head retention is good and laces nicely.  Aroma is roast coffee, chocolate, hints of nuts and a touch sour.  Has a good carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Has a good amount of coffee and anot real bitter.  Blended very well.  Has a watery texture which is very strange for a stout.  The body is light to medium for style.  Has a good mouthfeel.  The finish is light and a pleasing aftertaste.  A decent beer and an easy drinking stout.

Bottle  Pours a good purple black with a thin tan head.  The head leaves quickly, but laces okay.  Aroma is coccoa, roast, bitter coffee, and hint of vanilla.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is good.  Nice soft bitterness.  Good coffee and blended well.  Hides the alcohol nicely.  Has a medium body.  The texture is slick.  Has a decent finish the aftertaste is good.  Seems a touch on the flat side but not bad.
beer_name: Joseph James Red Fox Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: Bottle  Pours a nice black with a light brown head.  The head deminishes in time and laces nicely.  Aroma is bourbon barrell with sweet caramel, coffee, and hints of vanilla.  Has a light carbonation.  The flavor is real good, sweet with a good light alcohol burn.  Very pleasing not any bad effects, very well blended for a big boy beer.  The body is full.  Has a slick texture.  The finish is solid with a great aftertaste.  I waited a while to pop this one and it is awesome.  Great drinking beer that packs a solid punch.

Pounder Can  Pours a clear amber with a big off white head.  The head lasts well, with spotty at best lacing.  Aroma is citrus, pine, with touches of caramel.  Has an okay carbonation. Bottle

Pours a good reddish brown with a thin tan head.  The head leaves quickly.  Just leaves tiny rings of lacing.  Aroma is sweet, with hints of brown sugar some chocolate, and dark fruits.
